title: Alteryx vs Altana: Which analytics bi Tool is Better in 2025?
metaDescription: Compare Alteryx vs Altana. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best analytics bi tool for your needs in 2025.
introduction: Choosing between Alteryx and Altana for your analytics bi needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: Alteryx vs Altana
paragraphs: Alteryx is Alteryx Analytics Cloud is an end-to-end analytics automation platform that enables users to prep, blend, and analyze data from disparate sources, then deploy predictive models and analytic applications. Its core capability is providing a visual, no-code/low-code workflow interface that combines data preparation, data science, and process automation in a unified environment. What makes it unique is its focus on enabling business analysts and citizen data scientists to perform advanced analytics through drag-and-drop tools rather than requiring programming expertise.. It's known for data-preparation, workflow-automation, predictive-analytics.

Altana, on the other hand, is Altana is an AI-powered platform that creates a dynamic, shared map of the global supply chain by fusing public and private data. It enables businesses and governments to visualize complex trade networks, assess risks in real-time, and ensure compliance with global regulations. Its unique value lies in its 'single source of truth' atlas, built on a federated learning architecture that allows for secure data collaboration between entities without exposing proprietary information.. Users choose it for supply-chain-intelligence, global-trade-data, risk-analytics.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Alteryx excels in: Visual workflow designer with 300+ drag-and-drop tools for data prep and blending, AutoML capabilities for building and deploying predictive models without coding, Integrated data catalog with connectivity to 80+ data sources (databases, cloud apps, files). This makes it ideal for teams that need data-preparation.

Altana stands out with: Dynamic global supply chain map (The Atlas), Real-time risk scoring for entities and shipments, AI-powered forced labor compliance screening (UFLPA). It's particularly strong for users focused on supply-chain-intelligence.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose Alteryx if: You need data-preparation, work with workflow-automation, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Altana if: You prioritize supply-chain-intelligence, work in global-trade-data, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Alteryx Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.3/5), Extensive feature set.
Alteryx Cons: Paid plans may be needed for full features.
Altana Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.1/5), Comprehensive features.
Altana Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both Alteryx and Altana are solid choices for analytics bi. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: Alteryx is better for data-preparation, while Altana excels at supply-chain-intelligence. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
